H0.text: Turning out the lights to see better is the most important action when conducting an investigation involving an open flame.

H1.text: Smelling the product that is being burned is the most important action when conducting an investigation involving an open flame.

H2.text: Working near the sink to put out possible fires is the most important precaution when conducting an investigation involving an open flame.

H3.text: Wearing appropriate protective clothing and eyewear is most important when conducting an investigation involving an open flame.

A4.text: the use of personal protective equipment, and the use of the buddy system for particularly risky operations

A5.text: Correct eye protection should be worn in most experiments involving glassware
